curriculum_identification.title: Sustainable IT Operations
curriculum_identification.pathway_position: Core learning unit in Level 5 Certificate in Sustainable IT Operations

role_profile.title: Digital Sustainability Engineer
role_profile.description: Builds and maintains infrastructure for sustainability-related data pipelines, supporting ESG metrics and real-time monitoring.
role_profile.professional_context: This curriculum prepares learners to contribute to sustainable data infrastructure projects and environmentally responsible computing within IT departments or technology-driven organisations. Graduates will develop technical competences in green IT practices, energy-efficient system design, and sustainable cloud solutions. They typically support the development of environmentally conscious technology infrastructure and implement monitoring systems that track and optimise energy consumption across digital operations.

competence_frameworks_alignment.framework_note: Learning outcomes are mapped directly to GreenComp and e-CF framework descriptors

target_audience: IT professionals and engineers seeking to integrate sustainability principles into technical operations and infrastructure management
learning_approach: EQF Level 5 professional development programme with 2.0 ECTS, combining theoretical knowledge with practical application through structured learning and standardised work-based learning integration.

assessment_framework.rationale: Operations programmes emphasise hands-on technical competence and practical implementation skills
assessment_framework.wbl_component: Real-world technical implementation and system monitoring

employer_engagement.feedback_systems: Regular employer feedback on learning outcomes

quality_assurance.monitoring_systems: Regular quality monitoring of WBL delivery

flexible_learning_pathways.modular_design: Learning units designed for flexible recombination
flexible_learning_pathways.competence_catalog: Integrated with competence-based learning unit catalog
flexible_learning_pathways.pathway_flexibility: Multiple entry and exit points available

learning_units.learning_unit_description: Core sustainability concepts and their intersection with technology systems for digital professionals

learning_outcomes.knowledge: Compare cloud sustainability optimisation in introduction to digital sustainability within professional sustainability practice.
learning_outcomes.skills: Organise container orchestration of introduction to digital sustainability systems to support organisational sustainability objectives.
learning_outcomes.competence: Contribute to team leadership in green IT operations support for introduction to digital sustainability while ensuring professional standards and stakeholder value.

learning_units.pathway_guidance: This learning unit forms part of the Core learning unit in Level 5 Certificate in Sustainable IT Operations

dual_education_integration.employer_partnerships: Technology companies, data centres, cloud providers
dual_education_integration.mentor_support: Workplace mentor assigned for practical guidance
dual_education_integration.assessment_workplace: Workplace-based assessment comprising 16.0% of total assessment

catalog_reference.name: Introduction to Digital Sustainability
catalog_reference.description: Core sustainability concepts and their intersection with technology systems for digital professionals

stackability.horizontal_stacking: Can combine with other EQF 5 learning units
stackability.vertical_stacking: Can progress to EQF 6 advanced learning units

learning_units.learning_unit_title: Big Data for Environmental Intelligence (EQF 4 Version)
learning_units.learning_unit_description: Leverage big data technologies to analyze environmental patterns and trends (This learning unit has been adapted for EQF level 4.)

learning_outcomes.knowledge: Evaluate infrastructure monitoring techniques for big data for environmental intelligence (eqf 4 version) within professional sustainability practice.
learning_outcomes.skills: Plan energy monitoring implementation for big data for environmental intelligence (eqf 4 version) to support organisational sustainability objectives.
learning_outcomes.competence: Coordinate activities in technical implementation activities in big data for environmental intelligence (eqf 4 version) while ensuring professional standards and stakeholder value.

learning_units.pathway_guidance: This learning unit forms part of the Core learning unit in Level 5 Certificate in Sustainable IT Operations

dual_education_integration.employer_partnerships: Technology companies, data centres, cloud providers
dual_education_integration.mentor_support: Workplace mentor assigned for practical guidance
dual_education_integration.assessment_workplace: Workplace-based assessment comprising 18.7% of total assessment

catalog_reference.name: Big Data for Environmental Intelligence (EQF 4 Version)
catalog_reference.description: Leverage big data technologies to analyze environmental patterns and trends (This learning unit has been adapted for EQF level 4.)

stackability.vertical_stacking: Can progress to EQF 5 advanced learning units
